conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graph to determine average velocities.
Graph shows velocity on y-axis and time on x-axis for cars A and B.
v1 and v2 are initial and final velocities; intersection point shows equal speed.
Average velocity is total displacement divided by total time.
Use area under velocity-time curve to find average velocity for non-uniform motion.
Area under curve for Car A is bounded by line A from v2 to v1 and horizontal axis.
Area under curve for Car A is approximately half of rectangle formed by v2, v1, and t1.
Area under curve for Car B is bounded by line B from v1 to v2 and horizontal axis.
Area under curve for Car B is approximately half of rectangle formed by v2, v1, and t1.
Areas under curves for both cars are the same, so average velocities are equal.
Final answer: average velocities of cars A and B are the same.
